meanings.definition: The state or quality of being secondary.
meanings.sent1: Her secondariness in the play did not bother her as she enjoyed being part of the production.
meanings.sent2: In the group project, his secondariness was evident as he took on a supporting role.
meanings.sent3: The secondariness of the side character added a comedic touch to the serious play.
meanings.sent4: The secondariness of the moon in the night sky made the stars shine even brighter.
meanings.sent5: The secondariness of the backup dancer allowed the lead performer to shine on stage.

meanings.definition: The condition of being of lesser importance or rank.
meanings.sent1: The secondariness of the side dish did not diminish its delicious flavor.
meanings.sent2: In the company, her secondariness was evident as she held a lower position.
meanings.sent3: The secondariness of the clown in the circus act brought laughter to the audience.
meanings.sent4: The secondariness of the supporting actor highlighted the talent of the lead.
meanings.sent5: The secondariness of the background music enhanced the emotional impact of the scene.
